result.execSummary:
The defendant Oneil Deundre Perine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees taken from bail on deposit if any.  Balance to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds with balance due prior to the end of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence and as to count two. Credit for 20 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time/part time empoymetn and/or schooling.  Obtain GED/HSED.
No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
Shall participate in and cooperate with a cognitive thinking program.

AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
**Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of a firearm 941.29 Wis. stats makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever psosess a firearm, carrying with it it's ow 10 year period of imprisonment of $25,000.00 fine or both.  "possess weapons as convicted until your civil righs are restored 973.176(2).
Defendant shall not vote in any election until civil rights are restored 973.176(2).
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oneil Deundre Perine

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/24/14. AR

Defendant Oneil Deundre Perine in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence and as to Count 2, with credit for 20 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

AS TO COUNT 2:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 24 MONTHS, consecutive to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTE NDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.

Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees taken from bail on deposit, if any; and the balance to be paid up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time /  part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens.
*  Obtain GED/HSED.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab, if you have not previously done so. 973.046 & 973.047.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of a firearm - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearms, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. "Possess Weapon as Convicted Felon 0 973.176(1).
*  Defendant shall not vote in any election until your civil rights are restored - 973.176(2).
*  Defendant shall participate in and cooperate with a Cognitive Thinking Program.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Andrew J Golden.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  COURT ORDERED REPEATER PENALTY ENHANCERS DISMISSED.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-21-2014 at 08:30 am.
Original Motion Hearing Transcript (53 pages) commencing April 28, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Andrew J Golden.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds


  Plea hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Andrew J Golden.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel informs the court that he was just appointed late yesterday.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 44.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. cmt
No reply from surety or defendant.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Court advises the defendant he is allowed two appointments by the Public Defender's Office.  If motion is granted, this will be his second and final appointment.  Defendant states he understands.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney Garvin-Guimont to withdraw as counsel of record subject to public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw received and filed./ds

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Jedidiah Thompson.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn-in for the defense:  Oneil Perine.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds the officer did have a reasonable and articulable reason to stop the defendant and probable cause to arrest the defendant for obstructing.  State has met it's burden of proof showing the stop, arrest and search was legal.  Court denies motion.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
Court orders bail AMENDED to $2500 CASH.

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Vince Guimont for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Oneil D Perine in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Oneil D Perine in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Oneil D Perine in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
